metadata.name: anaverse - Forbidden cities #61
metadata.description: A symbol of power and isolation.

metadata.name: Firmament #30
metadata.description:
Everyone remembers what they were doing when they first heard about it. I was trying to scrape peanut butter from the bottom of the jar with a knife. School bell rings at 4, I’m usually home by 4:12, it must have been 4:17 when I heard the news. The kitchen radio is always on. They interrupted the song and told everyone to stop what they were doing and to look up.

I looked up and saw the kitchen’s ceiling. Then I heard people shouting outside and I saw it through the window. The grid. White lines in the sky. Impossibly tall. Impossibly light. Impossibly bright. I ran upstairs to my room. I opened the door wide and climbed on the roof through the window. It made the sun look so small. I climbed down. I changed into my evening clothes and closed the door of the cupboard. It’s important to close the cupboard otherwise it blocks my room’s door and you can’t open it from the outside anymore.

It's been three weeks now. It’s been both a very short time and an eternity. Everyone keeps talking about it. Everyone has a theory about it. Self-proclaimed specialists yield more and more explanations. Everyone thinks they’re right, thinks that they know what the grid means, that they broke the cypher. I have a theory too. I didn’t tell anyone. I wrote it on a notebook that I keep in my desk, opposite the cupboard. I have to close the cupboard otherwise it blocks my room’s door and you can’t open it from the outside anymore.

My theory is that there is no meaning to the grid. It’s there as a distraction. While we’re thinking about it, we forget about the rest. They made the grid to fascinate us while they were spreading. They’re making progress and we still haven’t realized it. To be honest, I’m surprised their plan works so well. A grid, whatever kind of grid it is, is a very low effort form of visual representation. And still, people are fascinated. This is the only thing they talk about. It shines brighter than the moon during the night. It’s everywhere. The only place where I can’t see it’s light is in my cupboard. I should not forget to close the cupboard otherwise it blocks my room’s door and you can’t open it from the outside anymore.

I’m getting ready. I don’t have a hunting license yet. I was supposed to start taking shooting lessons in September, but that’s still months away. They won’t wait for me. I took a long knife in the kitchen. My parents haven’t noticed. They don’t notice much in normal times either. I hid it in my bed, between the frame and the mattress. I have a baseball bat in the cupboard. I always close it otherwise it blocks my room’s door and you can’t open it from the outside anymore. 

Many people don’t come to school anymore. I have two good friends in my class, they still come. In the larger group of people I talk to everyday, maybe half don’t come anymore. Parents don’t say anything. Maybe they don’t know? Teachers don’t really teach anyway. They’re fascinated like the rest of them. We don’t really understand why. It’s like they all suddenly found how the world works. Or maybe they all found that the world doesn’t work in a particular way, that none of it matters. Either way, every time I get back home and write in my notebook, I realize it’s getting worse. Yesterday I thought I should hide it somewhere else, like in the cupboard. I hope I closed the cupboard otherwise it blocks my room’s door and you can’t open it from the outside anymore.
 
I came home an hour ago. My parents are not there yet. I don’t know if they ever will come back. I just climbed into my room to check on my notebook. I had left it at the usual spot in my desk in the end. I opened it, took a pen, and then it slowly dawned on me. I took a pen and put in in my mouth as if I was pondering on what to write. The knife is too far, I’ll never get to it. The chair is sturdy but it’s too heavy. The door of my cupboard is always closed otherwise it blocks my room’s door and you can’t open it from the outside anymore. Then why is it slightly open?

metadata.name: anaverse - Arcana sanctum #111
metadata.description: Sketches made by an anthropologist based on ancient texts describing the purgatory where lost souls wander.

metadata.name: Cités nuageuses #201
metadata.description:
Un de mes frères s’est envolé hier. Ou avant-hier, je ne sais plus. Il a vendu du lest pour sortir une fille. Une bourrasque soudaine les a emportés, lui et ses deux tickets de cinéma.

Cela fait bien trois semaines que nous n’avons pas eu de livraison. Pas de courrier non plus, par la même occasion. J’en reçois rarement. Je n’ai jamais reçu qu’une lettre, en réalité. C’était une longue lettre épistolaire de mon ami Dino. Il est cowboy, dans une cité voisine. 

Mon frère connaissait cette fille depuis bien cinq ou six ans. Il étaient au collège ensemble. Il y avait encore des livraisons toutes les semaines, à cette époque. Parfois deux fois par semaine. On pouvait vendre des enclumes et acheter du petit lest. Poids pour poids, on y perdait. Mais avec ça on arrivait quand même à vivre.

C’était le temps où les rochers n’étaient pas attachés. Ils dérivaient rarement, le vent n’était pas si fort. Et ils étaient plus denses aussi. Aujourd’hui, un rocher qui n’est pas en laisse ne sera plus là demain.

À l’époque, j’étais moi-même cowboy. Je vivais avec Jacques, un bon copain. Il n’y avait rien de sexuel entre nous. On gardait les rochers. Un soir, on jouait à l’espagnolette, il m’a relancé de trois alors que j’étais atout trèfle. Vous imaginez la suite. Je ne l’ai plus jamais revu après ça.

Plus personne ne va au collège. Mon frère était d’une des dernières générations. Après ça les gens ne voyaient plus l’intérêt. Tout devient de plus en plus léger, et apprendre à lire ou écrire ne pèse rien. Plus on mine, plus on vends des enclumes, plus on peut acheter du lest. Mais comme le lest est plus cher que les enclumes, à force, la cité devient de moins en moins lourde.

Le vent est de plus en plus fort aussi. Je pense que c’est pour ça qu’il y a moins de livraisons. Il y a de moins en moins de cités qui arrivent à rester suspendues. Celle de Dino s’est envolée l’année dernière, Dino avec. Avec moins de cités à visiter par voyage, les livraisons sont moins rentables.

Avant d’être cowboy je construisais des ponts. C’est comme ça que j’ai appris à lier les rochers. Plus personne ne le fait aujourd’hui. Il faut commencer par ancrer le rocher domestique. Et après, il faut attendre. C’est la partie la plus difficile. Personne n’a appris à suffisamment attendre. Parce que plus le temps passe, plus on devient légers. Mais c’est le plus important. Il faut attendre le que rocher sauvage devienne suffisamment léger. Sinon, il emportera le rocher domestique avec lui et on aura tout perdu.

Je me demande pourquoi il a acheté ces deux tickets de cinéma. C’est toujours le même film qui passe. Je ne l’ai jamais vu. Ça parle de dialectique et de maçonnerie, il paraît. Le cinéma c’est un domaine que je trouve trop contraignant. Encore une idée de bureaucrate. Places assignées. Horaires fixes. Un processus administratif au profit de la structure sociale. Classique. Les bureaucrates commencent toujours par nous exploiter et ils finissent par nous aliéner. “Servir le peuple”, ils appellent ça. 

Cela fait des années que le pont est de moins en moins solide. De toutes les façons, on n’a rien pour le réparer. Nos rochers sont domestiqués depuis le temps, mais ils s’entrainent les uns les autres au lieu de se stabiliser. La suspension des cités, ça a l’air simple mais ça ne l’est pas vraiment. Quand elles ont été construites, avec les machines-outils des livreurs, elles étaient bien suspendues. Mais peu à peu, elles se sont dégradées. La seule richesse des cités, c’est leur gravité. Pourquoi réparer ce qui est destiné à s’envoler ?

Je comprends pourquoi mon frère a vendu du lest. Après tout, le lest est là pour être vendu tant qu’il vaut encore quelque chose. Jeudi dernier, le pont est tombé. Notre deuxième rocher majeur est toujours relié par la chaine des rochers mineurs, mais elle ne va pas tenir longtemps. La cité va s’envoler bientôt. Peut-être demain ou après-demain. Je vous laisse, je dois aller miner.

attributes.name: Nombre de voitures dans le parking ?
Nombre de poneys ?
attributes.value: Mon chacal hollandais s'appelait Vital. C'est un nom très courant là-bas.

attributes.name: Nombre de pommes nécessaires (en moyenne) pour arriver au poids de trois enclumes ?
Nombre de pièces dans ma collection ?
Nombre de raviolis dans une boite de raviolis ?
Nombre de fois où le vent a failli m'emporter ?
attributes.value: Pourquoi vous voulez savoir ça ? Vous spéculez sur le marché secondaire ?

attributes.name: Nombre de jours dans une année ?
attributes.value: Puisque je vous répète qu'il n'y avait rien de sexuel entre nous.

attributes.name: Nombre de minutes de soleil un jour de solstice d'été ?
attributes.value: Pourquoi vous voulez savoir ça ? Vous spéculez sur le marché secondaire ?

attributes.name: Nombre de personnes dans la cité. ?
Nombre de laisses viables ?
attributes.value: C'est une vraie question. Je me souviens de ces longues soirées d'été, à l'ombre des peupliers en fleurs. À l'époque j'avais un adopté un chacal hollandais. Il était spécialisé dans les enchères. Nous partagions quelques croquettes en regardant le vent secouer les nuages. Mais vous connaissez déjà cette histoire, je me répète.

attributes.name: Nombre de collectionneurs qui n'ont strictement aucune idée de ce qu'ils collectionnent ?

attributes.name: Nombre de longues lettres épistolaires de mon ami Dino ?
attributes.value: Mon chacal hollandais s'appelait Vital. C'est un nom très courant là-bas.

attributes.name: Nombre de doses de lessive pour une machine à 60°C ?
attributes.value: Quand j'étais cowboy, beaucoup. Aujourd'hui, moins.

attributes.name: Nombre de monolithes ?
attributes.value: Puisque je vous répète qu'il n'y avait rien de sexuel entre nous.

attributes.name: Nombre de giraffes ?
attributes.value: Si vous pensez que vous allez m'avoir comme ça. L'espagnolette, c'est terminé pour moi.

attributes.value: En partant du début ou de la fin ?

metadata.name: Attachment #175
metadata.description:
The simplest of attachments still have elements of chaos.

The most complex may also feel the most secure.

S : Save current resolution
1 -> 4 : Save Low -> High Resolution

metadata.name: WTBS: Olympics Poster Edition #375
metadata.description:
WTBS: Olympics Poster Edition is our official collaboration with Jeres, who was kind enough to work with us in support of the show. The project leans into classic Olympic poster design motifs, embellished by Jeres' signature approach to color and shape. Huge thanks to Jeres for donating their time and enthusiasm to this one, we hope you enjoy it!

As with all WTBS projects, your minting will directly support the podcast and keep us going (and more importantly, collecting!). Our goal is to keep the show free from ads and fully supported by the community, your donations and contributions continue to make that possible. Thank you in advance to everyone who chooses to mint!

Jeres: I love vintage posters. When going to second-hand shops, flea markets or wherever people are selling their used goods, I’m always on the lookout for what people used to hang on their walls. Bauhaus-inspired posters, socialist propaganda, Nagel prints, anything art deco, etc.. but whenever I come across something Olympics inspired I always feel like I hit pay dirt. There’s something about the clean, simple design being used to show people coming together along with the undertones of human excellence that just feels special. And circles. I love circles. I hope you enjoy this collection as much as I enjoyed putting it together with Trinity and Will.

Approximate rarity notes:
5%: Gold Edition
10%: Silver Edition
15%: Bronze Edition 

Commands in fullscreen mode:
S : Save current resolution
1 : Save 2000x3000px
2 : Save 4000x6000px
3 : Save 6000x9000px
4 : Save 8000x12000px
5 : Save 10000x15000px

(The higher the resolution, the longer it takes to render/save. use Chrome for best results.)

metadata.name: Glossolalia #146
metadata.description:
This series is ultimately about catharsis. The compositions can be chaotic and maybe even a little messy, but they also can be vibrant and diverse… which is really what this is trying to celebrate: diversity and expression.

Simply, it’s about the emotions associated with whatever frees you.

Please see the linked fxtext article (on the main project page) for a more in-depth dissection of the concept. It’s less of a technical discussion, and more about the experience of the artist, and how it became linked with the feelings they associate with the art.

In live mode:

For higher resolutions, you can append “&density=2” to the url to double the size, “&density=3” to triple, and so on.
(This is highly recommended.)

To adjust grain, you can append “&grain=##” to the url. 40 is the default, and 0 will remove it completely.

metadata.name: Another brick #145
metadata.description:
...just another brick in the wall

[interactive]
chaos in order #2
experimental vintage series

press "SPACE" to show/hide grid
press "X" to start/stop movement
press "C" to turn on/off outline mode

metadata.name: Ichigo #241
metadata.description:
This generator is named 'Ichigo' (苺/ いちご), the Japanese word for 'strawberry'. 

Seeing each iteration from a suitable distance, small dots (to me, reminiscent of strawberry seeds) overlay different sequences of geometric repetitions, implying a sense of texture, grittiness and irregularity. 

By looking closer however, it becomes apparent to the viewer that the majority of the composition is in fact government by orderly elements, in this case grids of dots. 

This discovery invites the viewer to consider the output in front of them at different levels, near and far. At what point do you feel the dots begin to dissolve into a texture? When do you stop noticing the dots and instead begin to perceive the overall composition?

These questions are posed in a similar fashion as with meditation; at what point does something become something else? When does an in-breath become an out-breath and vice versa? 

Contemplation on simple questions like these can open a small portal into stillness and mindfulness by taking time to slowly observe our responses. 

23 palettes are included, each named after different areas of Tokyo. 

Press 'S' to download a full size 6000px x 6000px PNG output. 

As always, much gratitude and enjoy your piece.

metadata.name: The Soul of Flowers #7
metadata.description:
The Soul of Flowers: An Ode to Algorithmic Impressionism

In the tapestry of "The Soul of Flowers," the digital realm blossoms under the touch of algorithmic impressionism, weaving a dreamscape where art diverges into uncharted flora. Inspired by the ethereal interplay between dreams and reality, this masterpiece conjures flowers that dwell not in earthly gardens but in the imagination's boundless fields.

Each bloom, a digital mirage, mirrors the complexity of human perception, capturing the myriad souls in its petals. Here, flowers are not merely seen; they are felt, as they embody the diverse essences of life, painted in strokes of unseen colors and shapes.

"The Soul of Flowers" is a digital garden where each flower narrates its own poetic story, a fusion of art and technology that invites viewers to wander through a realm of beauty, redefining the boundaries between the virtual and the real.

metadata.name: Unbound #110
metadata.description:
About removing constraints, losing control, and freeing yourself.

- “s” save the output
- append “&disablegrain=1” to remove the grainy texture
- append “&size=<height>” to produce a bigger output

----

Alessandro Fiore, 2023.
See LICENSE.md for licensing details.

metadata.name: Attractor #104
metadata.description:
People are often drawn together over shared interest, and through their connections to those interests they find connections with others. Attractor is a visualization of community, a central interest bringing people together, pushing past their walls, bad habits, and traumas. The image is meant to be deceiving in its focus on the attractor, where the true focus is on the overlaps and complex defenses we build around ourselves. Those defenses can make us and those connections into more beautiful, ornate structures, or keep us distant from those around us. Sometimes focusing on a shared attractor is the only way we can let down our guard.

Press ’s’ to save a .png
Press ’t’ to toggle the grain for printing or personal preference
Press ‘p’ to save a higher quality .png
Created with p5.js and chroma.js

metadata.name: Balance #99
metadata.description:
Balance is a project made in 3 days while trying to find my own balance.
Made with p5.js;

Main Features:
- 8 color palettes.
- 2 sun types.
- 2 Waves.
- 2 Textures.
- 2 Outer shapes.

metadata.name: Linear Composition, Vol. 2 #120
metadata.description:
Inspired by old dot-matrix printers and in continuation of one of my previous series, "linear composition", this artwork explores linear and rectangular compositions combined with a very large matrix of small unique circular shapes . To see the artwork in detail, it is recommended to view it in high quality and zoom in. Various densities and more than 12 color palettes have been used.

-----------

- Add &density=2 to 12 to the live view URL to render the image at higher resolution.

- Press ’s’ on the live mode to save the artwork.

Made with p5js.

metadata.name: Gentrax EP #109
metadata.description:
Gentrax EP is a generative audiovisual artwork. Each iteration produces a generative house/garage track ~3 minutes in length while drawing out accompanying artwork. Live piece is aspect ratio agnostic and scales to any window size, but an aspect of 1:1.414 is preferred and can be set with an URL parameter.

Audio controls:
1-7: Channel mutes/unmutes
a: Filter up 
z: Filter down
c: Flanger on/off
v: Reverb (cycle thru three settings)
q: Switch bassline octave&seq (cycle thru three settings)
b: Portamento on/off

Visual controls: 
p: Fast forward to final artwork
o: Save canvas

Url parameters: 
&w=800 : Set width of canvas. If aspect ratio is not defined, artwork will be in preferred aspect ratio (1.41414)
&a=1.5 : Set aspect ratio. number <1 = Wide canvas
&wl=1 : Locks canvas aspect ratio to preferred 


made with p5.js & tone.js
Using tonejs synthesis for bass plus oneshot samples from various drum machines & Alpha Juno 2
<3

CC-BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Timelines #44
metadata.description:
#fxhashturnsone - Happy Birthday fxhash!

Some days are busy and some are quiet.
Some weeks go fast and some go slow.
Some months are good, some are bad.
Here we are: talking about, looking at, making, collecting, buying, selling, trading and obsessing about generative crypto art.
Artists, collectors, artworks, opinions, trends, ideas; continuously overlapping, intertwining, influencing, burying, surfacing, remembering and forgetting.
We keep going, in search of the next.

This algorithm draws lines horizontally across the canvas.
There can be 12, 52 or 365 lines.
The lines can be straight, curvy, or both.
Straight lines can be angled or horizontal.
The line thickness can be random from 1-365, or all 12, 52 or 365 pts.
And there are 12 colour palettes.

Inspired by Sol LeWitt’s Wavy Brushstrokes work and the fxhash tweet prompting “365 editions” a week ago.

Follow me on twitter @fauxjebus

~—~—~—~—~—~—~—~—~

Features:
F - Fullscreen
S - Save image
2/4/6/8/0 - Change image resolution (press number key and then reload in live view)
